Description: Liquid biopsy technologies are revolutionizing our ability to detect cancer at earlier stages, detect post-treatment minimal residual disease, monitor treatment response, and track tumor evolution. However, challenges remain that limit our ability to fully leverage these scientific findings and technological feats in clinical practice. Here we will cover liquid biopsy cell-free DNA analysis, and focus on features that enable precise quantitation, detection, and tumor tissue of origin inference. We will also discuss cell-free DNA mutational characteristics, genomic alterations, epigenomics and fragmentomics, applications to both adult and pediatric malignancies, biofluids beyond blood plasma for cell-free DNA extraction and analysis, and parallels between the circulating tumor DNA and non-invasive prenatal cell-free DNA fields. Finally, we will discuss exciting opportunities, while keeping in mind technical challenges, for clinical translation of modern cell-free DNA science and technology for cancer.
